Uses of Package
com.telekom.m2m.cot.restsdk.smartrest

  • Packages that use com.telekom.m2m.cot.restsdk.smartrest 
    Package Description
    com.telekom.m2m.cot.restsdk
    Cloud of Things Java SDK For further information see Readme.md or https://github.com/cloud-of-things/cot-java-rest-sdk To access the cloud of things server you instantiate a CloudOfThingsPlatform with the necessary CotCredentials.
    com.telekom.m2m.cot.restsdk.smartrest
    The smartrest package holds classes to access the SmartREST interface of the cloud of things server.
  • Classes in com.telekom.m2m.cot.restsdk.smartrest used by com.telekom.m2m.cot.restsdk 
    Class and Description
    SmartRequest
    Represents a request to send via SmartREST API.
    SmartResponse
    Represents a response received via SmartREST API.
    SmartRestApi
    The SmartRestApi is used to register and query SmartREST-templates and to execute requests against them.
  • Classes in com.telekom.m2m.cot.restsdk.smartrest used by com.telekom.m2m.cot.restsdk.smartrest 
    Class and Description
    SmartCepConnector
    The SmartCepConnector handles subscriptions and holds the connection to the CEP notification service.
    SmartListener
    A SmartListener receives real time notifications for messageIds, to which it was registered in the SmartCepConnector.
    SmartNotification
    A SmartNotification contains one line of the response data that was received from the server and the X-Id The data will be a CSV-String, not including the messageId.
    SmartRequest
    Represents a request to send via SmartREST API.
    SmartRequest.ProcessingMode 
    SmartRequestTemplate
    A SmartRequestTemplate is used server side to transform a SmartREST request into a regular REST request.
    SmartResponse
    Represents a response received via SmartREST API.
    SmartResponseTemplate
    A SmartResponseTemplate is used server side to transform a REST response into one line of a SmartREST response.
    SmartTemplate
    Base class for SmartRequestTemplate and SmartResponseTemplate, both of which have an id and need the same kind of escaping for some of their parameters.
